content: ] These guys and gals are friggin crooks. The sad thing is that a lot of 'em are former military. And the contracts they get are from former military working in DC as civilians. The fleecing of both military and civilian tax payers. Just think if that overbloated wasted money went towards something like schools or police/fire departments. I have been to many 3rd & 2nd world countries loaded with government corruption. The only difference between them and US is that we hide it behind laws and corporate umbrellas. This message has been edited. Last edited by: stillkit, Tue 05 May 2009 01:53 PM

content: Buzz Cii: If you're ex military, than you're smart enough to figure out how to be a dead-ringer for Harvard or Yale Law school candidates who are compassionate and want to straighten out corruption. As a dead-ringer, you can pose for an applicant and take the LSAT on the condition that the person you helped get admitted, promises you in writing to become a worker in our government, and do housecleaning to get rid of all the corruption. I say Harvard or Yale becaause if you're Ivy League, you're the first in line for any job. I don't know any other way to straighten out the corruption except to insert compassionate people who want to see justice done, into the system. These guys and gals are friggin crooks. The sad thing is that a lot of 'em are former military. And the contracts they get are from former military working in DC as civilians. The fleecing of both military and civilian tax payers. content: Cyber, No way! The Ivy League is corrupt too? My tactic is to not be part of the corruption by paying the least amount of taxes legally possible. Corruption is here to stay and so are taxes. It's how you play the game that matters. BTW: The next financial bubble boom will be Wallstreet and then it will burst in 2012 - 2015. The Dow will go to 20K and then puke back to 10-13K. You heard it from me first.
